method: Use pandas to load the train.csv and test.csv files.
Display the first few rows of each dataset using the head() method.
Check the dimensions of the datasets using the shape attribute.

task: Understand the data types and basic statistics
method: Use the info() method to get an overview of the data types and non-null counts.
Use the describe() method to get summary statistics for numerical features.
Use the isnull() method combined with sum() to count missing values in each column.
Visualize missing values using a heatmap (e.g., seaborn's heatmap).
Use the value_counts() method to get the distribution of categorical features.
Visualize the distribution of categorical features using bar plots.
Plot histograms for numerical features to understand their distributions.
Use box plots to identify potential outliers in numerical features.

task: Examine relationships between features and the target variable
method: Use groupby() and mean() to explore the relationship between categorical features and the target variable (Survived).
Use scatter plots or pair plots to examine relationships between numerical features and the target variable.
